code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:31 yo male urologist presents with mild epigastric pain for 4 days. patient also reports Stomach. he has a history of smoking he is a heavy drinker o:Height 74 in, Weight 189 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = mild tenderness to deep palpitation a:Ulcers p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed famotidine - 40 mg daily, and ordered serum helicobacter pylori assay.

s:patient presents with mild non pruritic rash. he has history of mild easy bruising. he is a male aged 31 Ys. o:Height 74 in, Weight 186 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed dexamethasone - 40 mg daily x 4 days, and ordered CBC.

s:31 yo white male with C/O mild fever for 8 days that is frequent. pt also reports mild cough. he is a heavy drinker patient reports that he smokes once or twice daily o:Height 73 in, Weight 183 lbs, Temperature 98.8 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered Chest X-Ray.

content2.Unmatched: patient reports that he smokes once or twice daily

td.content: s:a 31 YO male urologist presents with mild easy bruising. he has history of mild non pruritic rash. o:Height 73 in, Weight 182 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 72, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, Skin = pink, no pallor, Skin = scattered petechiae a:Idiopathic Thrombocytic Purpura p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed prednisone - 1 mg/kg daily, and ordered CBC.

s:white m urologist aged 32 years complained of mild epigastric pain. pt denied any fall or trauma. NKDA. patient has a history of excessive levels of alcohol consumption pt reports that he smokes once or twice daily o:Height 73 in, Weight 182 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 71, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = mild tenderness to deep palpitation a:Ulcers p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed NEXIUM - 40 mg daily, and ordered serum helicobacter pylori assay.

content2.Unmatched: alcohol consumption pt reports that he smokes once or twice daily

td.content: s:patient presents with mild fever x 3 weeks. patient also complains of mild cough. pt is a white male aged 32 years. o:Height 73 in, Weight 182 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 72, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered Chest X-Ray.
